item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Sara add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Sara add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sara add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "The meaning of life is that it stops." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I am not sure exactly what heaven will be like, but I know that when we die and it comes time for God to judge us, he will not ask, 'How many good things have you done in your life?' rather he will ask, 'How much love did you put into what you did?" -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Sara add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Sara add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Sara add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Sara add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sara add a quote by شاملو
item.description:
"کوه با نخستين سنگ‌ها آغاز مي‌شود و انسان با نخستين درد.
در من زندانی ستمگری بود که به آواز زنجیرش خو نمی کرد- من با نخستین نگاه تو آغاز شدم." -- شاملو

item.title: Sara add a quote by فردريش ويلهلم نيچه
item.description: "خجسته باد فراموشي انان كه سبب مي شود اشتباهايشان را بهتر تكرار كنند" -- فردريش ويلهلم نيچه

item.title: Sara add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "Liberty of thought is the life of the soul." -- Voltaire

item.title: Sara add a quote by فریدون مشیری
item.description: "من نمي دانم _ و همين درد مرا سخت مي آزارد_ كه چرا انسان اين دانا اين پيغمبر :در تكاپوهايش _چيزي از معجزه آن سو تر_ ره نبرده ست به اعجاز محبت چه دليلي دارد؟ * چه دليلي دارد كه هنوز مهرباني را نشناخته است؟ و نمي داند در يك لبخند !چه شگفتي هايي پنهان است * من بر آنم كه درين دنيا _خوب بودن _به خدا سهل ترين كارست و نمي دانم كه چرا انسان تا اين حد با خوبي .بيگانه است !و همين درد مرا سخت مي آزارد" -- فریدون مشیری

item.title: Sara add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "The time for action is now. It's never too late to do something." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Sara add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Each man must look to himself to teach him the meaning of life. It is not something discovered: it is something molded." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Sara add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Sara add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Sara add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "People in general are scared to death of the war and all the exhibition have been a failure, because the rich - don't want to buy anything" -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Sara add a quote by Frida Kahlo
item.description: "I think that little by little I'll be able to solve my problems and survive." -- Frida Kahlo

item.title: Sara add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "You do not need to leave your room. Remain sitting at your table and listen. Do not even listen, simply wait, be quiet, still and solitary. The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked, it has no choice, it will roll in ecstasy at your feet." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sara add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sara add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people." -- Virginia Woolf
